descriptions: As part of a development team of 3, I was responsible for building and maintaining an application using a LAMP tech stack that displayed a catalog of speakers on the website and app.
Using PHP, I created an application that controlled access to an event using QR codes.
In my role as a developer, I built and maintained an e-commerce application using AngularJS and a Ruby on Rails backend API. I also had the opportunity to learn about CI/CD and DevOps practices.

I contributed to the company's success by creating a cross-platform mobile app for iOS and Android using React Native and consuming existing API services. By not having to build a native app from scratch, the company was able to save $100,000, and sales increased by 20% in the first month.

To improve efficiency in the call center, I created a platform that used a data-driven architecture to enable agents to review and submit orders for customers in real time. Time spend on the phone was reduced by 30%.

As the lead of a team of 4 developers, I was responsible for building cross-platform mobile apps for iOS and Android using React Native. Our efforts paid off, resulting in a 35% increase in sales after the launch.

I led a team of 5 in building a front-end application using React and Redux for Walmart, enabling them to sell products internationally. We completed the project in 6 months and launched it within 3 months.

As the leader of a team of 5, I oversaw the development of a Backend for Frontend (BFF) using Golang and the Gin Framework to improve the efficiency of creating and managing content on the site using a new CMS.
Using GraphQL, React, and Node.js, I directed a team of 5 developers in building a new platform for international
I led a team of 3 developers in building a chat bot using React and Node.js to facilitate communication between customers and Walmart customer care.
